content.description:
This route has a cruxy roof start with low feet. Your hands start on two crimps - your left on a little edge and your right up in on smaller. You get crumbly feet for the start. Work up and right towards more crimps. Some bigger moves will work you straight up with a nice right hand on the topout.

Skipping the first moves and starting on the two close hands makes it an easier V3.
content.location: From the Bear Lake trailhead, start walking towards the lake, staying right. Shortly afterwards you'll hit a trail towards Bierstadt Lake. On that trail, 20 yards in front of you is the backside of the boulder. It should be an easy find.

content.description: Do a two hand start on a jug to the lower right, and work your way left on some small ledges with good feet. Match on a small ledge before bumping up to a good flake. Work right to another flake, and finish on a jug. I chose not to top out with the fragile vegetation on top, but this is still a fun, overhanging route ending at the jug. Make sure to stay off the vegetation to the left of the landing.
content.location: It is on the south side of Bear Lake. At Bear Lake trailhead, take the trail wrapping around the lake to the left. Keep going until you come out of the wooded area with an opening to see the lake. Behind you is the route on the beautiful overhang with a sloped landing.
